g2:c.PROCEDURE.g2:a.TEXT: devtools-startup-procedure (Startup: class gfr-startup-object ) DocDetails: class protools-documentation-details; begin for DocDetails = each protools-documentation-details upon the workspace of Startup do conclude that the item named by the protools-associated-item of DocDetails is protools-subject-of-authored-item DocDetails end; end

g2:c.FREE-TEXT.g2:a.TEXT: display a table of the table-header and notes of every item with notes and assigned to module gdabasic

c.PROTOOLS-TO-DO.g2:a.TEXT: I bumped this devapps item down so it could be shared with NOL. This causes problems, one of which is that it required GFR a lower level. The way that the development tools are used in the hierarchy should be examined.

g2:Sequence.rdf:li: No benchmark data was available. The time for your activity was [1] miliseconds.

The time for each iteration of your loop was [1] miliseconds. Subtracting off the time to perform the do loop, is a total for your activity was [2] milliseconds. This is [3] X the speed of a the benchmark[4].
"The timing procedure took [1] seconds to execute. Consider changing the number of iterations to bring this number between 5 and 10 seconds"
No benchmark data was available. The time for your activity was [1] miliseconds.

The time for each iteration of your loop was [1] miliseconds. Subtracting off the time to perform the do loop, is a total for your activity was [2] milliseconds. This is [3] X the speed of a the benchmark[4].
"The timing procedure took [1] seconds to execute. Consider changing the number of iterations to bring this number between 5 and 10 seconds"

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: Original bindings
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: change the text of the item-configuration of kb-configuration to "[orig-conf]"

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: VKP bindings
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: in order conclude that orig-conf = the text of the item-configuration of kb-configuration and change the text of the item-configuration of kb-configuration to "[orig-conf]; clicking control + mouse-down on any item implies go-to-subworkspace; clicking control+shift+mouse-down on any item implies describe "

g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.LABEL: MODULE-INFORMATION!
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.ACTION: start protools-inform (this window, "The module is [get-module(the item)]", 0, the item)

g2:c.FUNCTION-DEFINITION.g2:a.TEXT: Get-Module-Connection(X) = (If there exists an object Y connected to X then get-module(Y) else "unspecified")

g2:c.MESSAGE.g2:a.TEXT:
The check on logbook-pages in Get-Module-ws is because when called in the inspector, logbook pages cause the following error:
#387 9:55:42 a.m. Error in GET-MODULE-WS: Cannot reference the text of the MODULE-ASSIGNMENT of LOGBOOK-PAGE-XXX-325.
When called from a procedure in user code, iterations over all items do not see logbook-pages in the first place,so the problem does not arise. All my efforts to test whether the attribute "has a value" failed to work right.

g2:c.FUNCTION-DEFINITION.g2:a.TEXT: Get-Module-ws(X) = (if the item superior to X exists then Get-Module-Item(the item superior to x) else (if x is not a logbook-page then the text of the module-assignment of x else "unspecified"))
Get-Module-Item(X) = (If the workspace of X exists then get-module-ws(the workspace of x) else if the item superior to X exists then get-module-item(the item superior to X) else "unspecified")

g2:c.MESSAGE.g2:a.TEXT:
Get-Module is a g2 function which accepts any workspace or other item, and returns the text of the name of the module it belongs in, or "none" if there is none.
This enables, among other things, inspect commands such as this one:
highlight "column" in every procedure P such that Get-Module(P) = "matrix-displays"

g2:c.GRAPH.g2:a.EXPRESSIONS-TO-DISPLAY: region-1-memory-usage in red; region-2-memory-usage in blue; memory-usage in green

g2:c.FREE-TEXT.g2:a.TEXT: TO START MEMORY METERING, ENABLE THIS WORKSPACE AND TURN ON METER-SERVICE

g2:c.RULE.g2:a.TEXT: whenever memory-size receives a value and when memory-size - current-memory-size > 100000 then in order start gdl-beep2(1) and conclude that current-memory-size = memory-size

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: meter-service
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: change the text of the g2-meter-data-service-on of every data-server-parameters to "YES"

g2:c.FREE-TEXT.g2:a.TEXT: Random stuff that was in GDA

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: Check Unused
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: start gfr-check-for-unused-translations (text-resource-reference-bin, this workspace, this window)

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: Search Selected Resources
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: start run-search-on-selected-resources ("gda", this workspace, text-resource-reference-bin, this window)

g2:c.READOUT-TABLE.g2:a.EXPRESSION-TO-DISPLAY: the number of elements in text-resource-reference-bin

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: Filter Bin
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: start gfr-filter-out-references-with-text (text-resource-reference-bin, the symbol nothing, this window)

g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.LABEL: GO-TO-PROCEDURE
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.CONDITION: validating-text-resource-references and the procedure that is gfr-text-referenced-by the item exists
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.ACTION: start protools-flash-on-item (the procedure that is gfr-text-referenced-by the item, 5, this window)

g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.LABEL: STORE-REFERENCES
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.CONDITION: validating-text-resource-references and the subworkspace of the item exists

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: Search Module
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: start gfr-search-for-proper-use-of-text-resources ("gda", text-resource-name-array, this workspace, text-resource-reference-bin, this window)

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: Check Unused
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: start gfr-check-for-unused-translations (another-text-resource-reference-bin, this workspace, this window)

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: Search Selected Resources
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: start run-search-on-selected-resources (gfr-module-choices , this workspace, another-text-resource-reference-bin, this window)

g2:c.READOUT-TABLE.g2:a.EXPRESSION-TO-DISPLAY: the number of elements in another-text-resource-reference-bin

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: Filter Bin
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: start gfr-filter-out-references-with-text (another-text-resource-reference-bin , the symbol nothing, this window)

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: Search Module
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: start gfr-search-for-proper-use-of-text-resources (gfr-module-choices, text-resource-name-array, this workspace, another-text-resource-reference-bin , this window)

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: Purge
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: for any symbol P in list-of-attribute-symbols unconditionally remove P from list-of-attribute-symbols

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: Purge Top
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: remove the first item-or-value from list-of-attribute-symbols

g2:c.READOUT-TABLE.g2:a.LABEL-TO-DISPLAY: The number of elements to be processed

g2:c.READOUT-TABLE.g2:a.EXPRESSION-TO-DISPLAY: the number of elements in list-of-attribute-symbols
g2:c.READOUT-TABLE.g2:a.LABEL-TO-DISPLAY: Number of attributes which have to have references located

g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.LABEL: REMOVE-FROM-TREE-LIST
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.CONDITION: tree-shaking and the item is a member of list-of-procedures

g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.LABEL: ADD-TO-TREE-LIST
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.CONDITION: tree-shaking and the item is not a member of list-of-procedures
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.ACTION: insert the item at the end of list-of-procedures

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: Purge Pairs
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: for any g2-list G2L in list-of-symbol-pairs unconditionally delete G2L

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: Purge
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: for any procedure P in list-of-procedures unconditionally remove P from list-of-procedures

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: Purge Top
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: remove the first item-or-value from list-of-procedures and delete the first item-or-value in list-of-symbol-pairs

g2:c.READOUT-TABLE.g2:a.LABEL-TO-DISPLAY: The number of elements to be processed

g2:c.READOUT-TABLE.g2:a.EXPRESSION-TO-DISPLAY: the number of elements in list-of-procedures
g2:c.READOUT-TABLE.g2:a.LABEL-TO-DISPLAY: Number of procedures which have to have references located

g2:c.FREE-TEXT.g2:a.TEXT: A file is generated which gives the listing of all the unused variables for each procedure.

c.PROTOOLS-COMMENT.g2:a.TEXT: These buttons make it possible to show the label of uil navigation buttons as an attribute display by temporarily changing the item configurations.

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: change the text of the item-configuration of every uil-goto-workspace-button to "none"

change the text of the item-configuration of every uil-goto-workspace-button to "configure the user interface as follows: unless in administrator mode: table menu choices for any uil-goto-workspace-button include additionally: show-attribute-display, hide-attribute-display, move "

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: empty authors slot of relations
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: for any relation Itm unconditionally change the text of the authors of Itm to "none" and make Itm permanent

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: empty authors slot of definitions
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: for any definition Itm unconditionally change the text of the authors of Itm to "none" and make Itm permanent

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: empty authors slot of procedures
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: for any procedure Itm unconditionally change the text of the authors of Itm to "none" and make Itm permanent

g2:c.BORDERLESS-FREE-TEXT.g2:a.TEXT: This devtool-change-message has slight differences from the standard devtools class

g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.LABEL: IDENTIFY-NEXT-GROBJ
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.CONDITION: (the item is a uil-radio-button or the item is a uil-edit-box) and the workspace W of the item exists and there exists a gdl-lite-passive-text upon W

g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.LABEL: CLEANUP-MASTER-DIALOG
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.CONDITION: protools-umc-active and devtools-clean-up-master-umc and there exists a gdl-dialog-intermediary GDI such that (the id of GDI = the class of the item)

g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.LABEL: RESTORE-AND-ALIGN-FIELDS
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.CONDITION: protools-umc-active and devtools-align-fields-umc and the subworkspace W of the item exists

g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.LABEL: ALIGN-FIELDS!
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.CONDITION: protools-umc-active and devtools-align-fields-umc and the subworkspace W of the item exists and there exists a gdl-lite-passive-text upon W

g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.LABEL: FIND-MASTER-DIALOG
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.CONDITION: protools-umc-active and devtools-find-master-dialog-umc and there exists a gdl-dialog-intermediary GDI such that (the id of GDI = the class of the item)

g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.LABEL: LOG-CHANGE!
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.CONDITION: protools-umc-active and devtools-log-change-umc and the item is not a connection and the item is not a kb-workspace
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.ACTION: in order create a devtool-change-message R and start devtool-initialize-devtool-change-indicator (R, this window)

g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.LABEL: TO-DO!
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.CONDITION: protools-umc-active and devtools-todo-umc and the item is not a connection and the item is not a kb-workspace
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.ACTION: in order create a protools-to-do R and start devtool-initialize-devtool-to-do (R, this window)

g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.LABEL: ADD-COMMENT!
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.CONDITION: protools-umc-active and devtool-comment-umc and the item is not a connection and the item is not a kb-workspace
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.ACTION: in order create a protools-comment R and transfer R to the workspace of the item at (the item-x-position of the item + 50, the item-y-position of the item) and make R permanent

g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.LABEL: ADD-DEVELOPER-HEADER!
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.ACTION: in order create a devtool-header R and transfer R to the mouse of this window

g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.LABEL: ALIGN-LABEL
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.CONDITION: the workspace W of the item exists and there exists a gdl-lite-passive-text upon W

g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.LABEL: ALIGN-LABELS
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.CONDITION: the subworkspace W of the item exists and there exists a gdl-lite-passive-text upon W

g2:c.PROCEDURE.g2:a.TEXT: g2-hide-attribute-displays(Itm: class item) begin system call g2-hide-attribute-displays(Itm); end
g2-hide-name-box(Itm: class item) begin system call g2-hide-name-box(Itm); end

g2:c.BORDERLESS-FREE-TEXT.g2:a.TEXT: All menu choices from devtools appear with an exclamation mark (!) to make them easy to identify as coming from devtools. To hide the menu choices, de-select the check box on the devtools control panel.
The DEVTOOLS module originated in GDA, but was forked before GDA became 5.0 compatible This workspaces in this heirarchy provide some additional facilities available in the GDA version.
